tldr.bestFor: Quick social videos when you're okay working within monthly credit budgets
tldr.notFor: Users who want precise manual edits, low credit burn, or flexible refunds
tldr.why: Free plan has branding watermarks, cancellations can end access immediately, and refunds are stated as not provided

miniTest.prompt: Create a 30-45 second video from this text about [topic] for [platform]. Keep claims factual, add on-screen captions, and use stock visuals that match each sentence. Produce a version optimized for social sharing
miniTest.verdict: Result: partial. Biggest constraint was credits/customization/bugs/watermark. If you need predictable HD specs or refund flexibility, verify plan terms before committing

useCases.title: YouTube Shorts
useCases.why: Generate quick captioned clips, but watch credit burn per video

useCases.title: Marketing Ads
useCases.why: Rapid iterations are possible; manual fine-tuning may be limited

useCases.title: Blog-to-video
useCases.why: Can draft a video script from blog text, then generate a short cut

keyFeatures: Free plan includes branding watermarks; paid plans remove them
Free plan includes 25 credits monthly (about 5 minutes)
Access to royalty-free stock clips, images, and music
Supports common formats like MP4 and MOV for sharing
Web-based workflow; desktop mode recommended by users
Higher tiers may include advanced features like voice cloning

pros: Free tier exists for basic testing
cons: User reports: videos can consume too many credits
User reports: fewer outputs than some competitors
User reports: bugs or hiccups can occur
User reports: limited manual customization and tweaks
No refunds for paid periods already paid
Cancellation may end access immediately, without refund

verdict.bottomLine: Zebracat is best for creators who need quick social video generation and can work within monthly credit budgets. The trade-off is control: manual customization is limited, credits can burn faster than expected, and cancellation ends access immediately with no refunds. Free plan includes watermarks; paid tiers remove them but verify exact export specs before committing.

faqs.question: Does the Free plan include a watermark?
faqs.answer: Yes—Free plan outputs include branding watermarks, and paid tiers remove them. Watermark behavior should be verified on official pricing if you need certainty.

faqs.question: How many credits does the Free plan include?
faqs.answer: The Free plan includes 25 credits monthly, roughly equal to about 5 minutes of video. Treat this as plan guidance rather than a precise production guarantee.

faqs.question: Is export resolution 1080p or 4K available?
faqs.answer: Available evidence only mentions HD output in user reviews. Confirm exact resolution options in official plan documentation before buying.

faqs.question: What file formats can I export?
faqs.answer: MP4 and MOV are referenced as correct formats for video files. Verify the complete export format list and whether audio-only exports exist.

faqs.question: Can I cancel anytime, and what happens when I do?
faqs.answer: Once cancellation is initiated, the subscription ends immediately. Remaining paid time is not refunded.

faqs.question: Do they offer refunds?
faqs.answer: No refunds are provided for subscription periods already paid. If refunds matter, confirm directly in official terms before subscribing.

faqs.question: Are commercial rights included?
faqs.answer: Many platforms grant commercial licenses on paid tiers. Check Zebracat's official terms for the exact license scope.

faqs.question: Does it include royalty-free stock media?
faqs.answer: Reviews describe access to millions of premium stock clips, images, and music tracks. Verify the exact providers, licensing terms, and any plan limits.

faqs.question: Can it convert blog posts to video?
faqs.answer: An NLP workflow analyzes text and generates a script for video creation. The quality of results may still require manual edits.

faqs.question: What features are exclusive to higher-tier plans?
faqs.answer: Voice cloning may be available only on higher tiers. Verify which plan includes it and any usage limits.

faqs.question: Why do some users say it's expensive in credits?
faqs.answer: User reports: creating videos can take too many credits and may yield fewer outputs than competitors. Your mileage will depend on video length and generation settings.

faqs.question: Is it stable and easy to customize?
faqs.answer: User reports: you may run into bugs or hiccups, and customization options can feel limited. If your workflow needs frame-level control, test thoroughly before upgrading.
